ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Windows NEAT - errors?
ygData.msgSnippet: No, in C and C++, the increment is atomic to the expression. So it is bound to the n at the time the increment, which happens at the end of the loop, and

No, in C and C++, the increment is atomic to the expression. So it is 
bound to the 'n' at the time the increment, which happens at the end of 
the loop, and cannot extend over the loop as a whole.

On 13/01/2011 13:14, Robert DeLisle wrote:
> In the case off parsing vectors, does it not skip the element at 0?
>
